question.content: related question: in what priority will new features be considered? e.g. player's requests, ease of implementation, lowest "cost", pre-existing things to tie in to, ...

referenced_message.content: FWIW: I'm asking these questions rhetorically. Mostly I'm making the point that said feature involves a lot more than one might think compared to "press button, play sound in multiplayer game", and as a general game dev bit of insight, that's why a seemingly simple feature can be far more complicated to develop. But this is true with practically everything. So we're doing these kind of "how do we do X, what else would it need, what else *wouldn't* we be doing because we spent this time doing X?" all the time.

answer.content: That's not something I would even really have the authority to answer. These are all big picture considerations and priorities shift based on all kinds of factors. Part of my responsibility is to help give my teammates with the big picture in their head the most useful information to help decide. Of course, I also have my own personal beliefs and thoughts on these things and express that, but I trust the proverbial "forest" ranger while I work on the "trees". Which is my half-baked attempt to stretch the "forest vs trees" idiom way too far.
